group_1.textRight: Is something wrong, Tsuruno?@You've been zoning out...

group_1.textLeft: I can't tell what the right thing to do is.

group_1.textRight: You mean...the debt moratorium?

group_1.textLeft: That's one part of it.
The people of Mizuna and Suitoku are@trying to save everyone around them,
but the lord of the whole domain is so selfish that@he won't do anything to help the other clans...
But each territory is under its own circumstances,@so I can't say if what they're doing is right or wrong.

group_1.textRight: It reminds me of our situation@not so long ago...

group_1.textLeft: I think you're right.
We all wanted to save others and be saved,@but even though we all felt the exact same way,
our circumstances meant we couldn't@work together.

group_1.textRight: That's right...
...The Union, Promised Blood,@the Tokime Clan, Neo-Magius,
and Folklore of Zero...
We all had different goals and@clashed with each other...
But at long last, in the end,@to save Magical Girls,
we all came together as one.

group_1.textLeft: Princess Tsuyu is also following her ideals@down that same path of thorns.

group_1.textRight: Is there any way we can help her?

group_1.textLeft: If we follow history, then she'll succeed.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, that's right.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you for putting yourself on the line@for the people's sake, Gen'un.

group_1.textRight: I simply eliminated the interest and@carried the debt over to next year.
What I did was nothing compared to@the actions of your clan.

group_1.textLeft: Even just eliminating the interest@will be a great boon.
Besides, our clan's impact is merely@limited to the Hokuyo area.
Meanwhile, there are countless people all over@who are in your debt, so you'll be helping many.

group_1.textRight: ...Those who live here in Sango will@at least have some relief.
But the people here without connections@to our temple will still suffer.

group_1.textLeft: What do you mean...?

group_1.textRight: They will either be reduced to thievery,@or be forced to migrate to other lands.
And just like the incident of@the sacred tree,
the elders who serve as mediators@will not be able to escape...

group_1.textLeft: And there's nothing we can do to help...

group_1.textRight: [chara:832700:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Hrm?!
What's all this commotion about?

group_1.textLeft: The whole temple's in an uproar...

group_1.textRight: Lord Sango must have acted.

group_1.textLeft: Do you know something about this...?

group_1.textRight: According to our records, some peasants who could@no longer bear the exorbitant tax fled to other lands.
Many people were hurt in the process@of stopping them.
Even in this era of endless war, farmers@and peasants are valuable in their own right.
It seems this lord lacks the temperament@required of his station.

group_1.textLeft: The nobles and peasants all wanted to be saved,@but couldn't come to terms, so slaughter ensued...
But Iroha was still able to save everyone...

group_1.textRight: Yes, so we can, too.
You're free to subdue the soldiers,@but do not harm the generals.

group_1.textLeft: Wait, you mean it's okay@to put a stop to this...?

group_1.textRight: That's exactly what I'm saying.
Tsuruno! Sana!

group_1.textLeft: Is this about Lord Sango deploying@soldiers to collect taxes?

group_1.textRight: Word travels fast.
Still, we can't allow this to happen,@even on another clan's territory!

group_1.textLeft: We'll be right there with you, Princess!

group_1.textRight: [chara:104501:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]What?!

group_1.textLeft: Allow us to help protect the people@of Sango...no, the people of Soma!

group_1.textRight: But I was going to tell you to stay in the@temple until the situation was resolved...
